answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Yes, you are having some neurological problem involving one half of your body. First of all a MRI can only rule out seizures that are caused by some worm in brain or bleed or tumor or brain injury. It is not the test to diagnose seizures due to faulty chemical impulses in the brain. This is done by an EEG or Electro Encephalo Gram. Again having a normal EEG does not rule out epilepsy or seizures. It is just a diagnostic aid and is often normal in people having seizures. It can also be abnormal in those not having seizures.Hypertension, diabetes, strokes or transient ischemic attacks too should be looked into. A CT scan or MRI of the brain should be done to rule this out.The third possibility is cervical nerve compression very high up. Again an MRI will be diagnostic.It could also be due to hypoglycemia.It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Consult a neurologist regarding this as soon as possible. If you are unable to get this soon, and if you have a similar attack, rush to the ER for the tests. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

thanks very much, i went to my doctor today and he didnt seem to concerned about the whole eyes rolling back situation. how ever. i did get blood taken for several test. one was for diabetes. my mom has it so it could be very possible that i do too. hopefully the results come back soon and nothing to major.

question: this morning i was laying in bed and as i rolled over, my eyes felt like they were rolling into the back of my head and my bod felt very shakey. previous to this, i've been very tired, regular head aches, a pain in my left side for about a half an hour for one day, also i get dizzy spills from time to time. dose anyone know what i should do?
title: dose anyone possibly know what could be wrong with me??
